result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin L Jones in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kevin L Jones.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has discovery and an offer. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin L Jones in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kevin L Jones.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Michael R Staskunas. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of all discovery and an offer.  Defense requests additional time to review discovery and offer with defendant.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Court advised the defendant that all conditions of bail remain in full force effect.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin L Jones in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin L Jones in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defense requests an adjournment for time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Kevin L Jones in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/06/2022@2p
